citation.article-title: Halomonas elongata, a new genus and species of extremely salt-tolerant bacteria.

p.s: Description of Halomonas elongata sp. nov.
Halomonas elongata (e.lon.ga'ta. L. fem. part. adj. elongata elongated, stretched out)
Inasmuch as the genus currently contains only one species, the description of this species is the same as that given above for the genus.
The type strain of H. elongata is 1H9, a culture of which has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC 33173).
It, along with most of the s t r a h , possesses urease and liquefies gelatin.
The only distinguishing characteristics noted, so far, are that it is able to produce slight visible growth at 4°C and survives 45°C in 8 to 20% solar salt.
Strain 1H15 (ATCC 33174) is regarded as belonging to a biovar of this species because its cells are lophotrichous and it is unable to grow at 37°C in the presence of 32% solar salt.
